intro: Chirita macrophylla var. tirapensis, commonly known as the Tirap chirita, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
